requirement_text: Personal data must be processed lawfully, fairly, and transparently.
Data must be collected for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes.
Only adequate, relevant, and necessary data should be collected.
Personal data must be accurate and kept up to date.
Data should not be kept for longer than necessary.
Personal data must be processed securely to prevent unauthorized access.
Data controllers must demonstrate compliance with all principles.
Individuals have the right to access their personal data.
Individuals can request correction of inaccurate personal data.
Individuals can request deletion of their personal data.
Processing must have a lawful basis (e.g., consent, legal obligation).
Consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous.
Children's data must be handled with additional protection measures.
Data protection impact assessments are required for high-risk processing.
Organizations must report data breaches within 72 hours.
Data must be protected during international transfers.
Contracts must be in place with processors handling personal data.
Organizations must maintain data processing records.
Profiling and automated decision-making must be transparent and fair.
Data must not be used in ways incompatible with initial purposes.
Special category data must have stronger safeguards.
Individuals have the right to data portability.
Marketing communications require clear consent.
Privacy notices must explain data usage in plain language.
Surveillance (e.g., CCTV) must be justified and minimally intrusive.
All staff must be trained on data protection policies.
Regular audits must ensure data protection compliance.
Organizations must have a Data Protection Officer if required.

Access to data must be restricted based on job roles.
